judges: Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and Eagen, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The order of the Orphans’ Court of Philadelphia County disbarring Harry J. Alter, Jr., from practicing in that court and striting his name from the court’s roll of attorneys is affirmed on the opinion of President Judge Klein, reported in 16 Pa. D. & C. 2d 653.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: W. J. Woolston, with him Francis F. Walter, and David Bortin, for appellant.
Henry T. Beath, amicus curiae and Chairman, Committee of Censors of Philadelphia Bar Association, in propria persona, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Alker Disbarment Case.
January 19, 1960:
Argued January 12,1960.
Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and Eagen, JJ.
W. J. Woolston, with him Francis F. Walter, and David Bortin, for appellant.
Henry T. Beath, amicus curiae and Chairman, Committee of Censors of Philadelphia Bar Association, in propria persona, appellee.
